chargeHist.descr: Child Abuse - Intentionally Cause Great Bodily Harm

result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas S. Dulaney was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Thomas S. Dulaney is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Thomas S. Dulaney was found guilty of Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharges.  May Not have contact with Mary S or her family unless otherwise permitted by the court only.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

timeConds.notes:
Huber allowed.  Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the Court, an inmate serving time as a condition of probation is eligible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every 3 days of work performed.  
NOTE:  Credit for 1 day.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Thomas S. Dulaney, appeared with Attorney John Louis Caviale.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights and sentencing arguments made.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 1 year with conditions.  As a condition court imposes 45 days in the KCJ commencing on 7/18/15 at 8:00 AM.  Huber & Work Crew authorized.  No contact with Mary S. or her family unless permitted by the court only.  Cash Bond on deposit is to be applied.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.
Sentencing date changed to 7/9/15 at 11:30 AM per confirmation with Atty Caviale and Atty Trigg.  Atty Caviale will provide notice to his client.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Thomas S. Dulaney, appeared with Attorney John Louis Caviale.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights and case is resolved.  Count 1- DE pleads No Contest; found guilty by the court.  Counts 2 & 3 - Dismissed by the State.  PSI ordered for Sentencing on 7/24/15 at 11:00 AM.

Defendant, Thomas S. Dulaney, appeared with Attorney John L. Caviale.  Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES:  Defense Attorney requesting an adjournment, needs more time as there was no DA PTC.  Matter set over, bond continued.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 25, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. John Caviale. Clerk LE. Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 4. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 8-14-14 @ 2:00pm. Bond continued.
